#Introduction 
```{r}
library(neuralnet)
library(caret)
library(tidyverse)
library(mlbench)
library(e1071)

```

Chapter 2

In this chapter we discuss how to store the data frame in an object.  We go over the structure.  Finally we do some quick Exploratory Analysis to see the balance of the data set.


```{r}
data("PimaIndiansDiabetes")
df <- PimaIndiansDiabetes
str(PimaIndiansDiabetes)
ggplot(df, aes(df$diabetes, fill = as.factor(diabetes))) + geom_bar()
```
Chatper 3 

We create a binary variable for our Independent/Response Variable.  

```{r}
df$binary <- ifelse(df$diabetes == "neg", 0, 1)
```


Chapter 4 We create a Train/Test split using caret's createDataPartition function.

```{r}
rows <- createDataPartition(df$binary, times =1,
                            p = .7, list = F)
train <- df[rows,]
test <- df[-rows,]


```

Chapter 5

We create our Model

```{r}

model <- train(as.factor(binary) ~ ., 
               data = train,
               method = "ranger",
               trControl = trainControl(method = "repeatedcv", number = 2, repeats = 2))

model
```

Chapter 6 We test our model on the Test set and build a Confusion Matrix.

```{r}
pred_train <- predict(model, train)
pred_test <- predict(model, test)

pred_train

confusionMatrix(pred_train, as.factor(train$binary))
confusionMatrix(pred_test, as.factor(test$binary))
```
